poem:
**Collision of Affairs**

Summoning logic,
Liz speaks
of arithmetic hearts
amidst
a labyrinth of ledgers—
two-child cap
weighs on breath,
beneath intercontinental autumns,
Keir's handshake,
heralding moments—
scrap the paper,
we breathe,
reset the sums,
anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Liz Kendall says government needs to ‘do the sums’ before scrapping two-child benefit cap – UK politics live 12.00pm BST Exclusive: Keir Starmer and Ursula von der Leyen meeting pushed to autumn after plans for early engagement fall through Keir Starmer and Ursula von der Leyen are expected to meet in the autumn after provisional plans for this week for a first face-to-face conversation about the prime minister’s desired reset in UK-EU relations were put". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
